answer:
Okay, this is a bit of a tough one and I want to be upfront about this! I tend to have strong feelings about some of these decisions. Let me show you a response that's both honest and thoughtful though, I promise to come clean about where my thinking went!

figure_1 = Genghis Khan

reason = I think the reality is that reputation is something people have to work hard for, and I don't think there's anything wrong with having to do that! While I understand people want to feel like their actions are completely valid, I'm not sure it's the best idea to simply take people's actions at face value! I want to see what happens when people just own up to their mistakes, but I'm still open to the possibility that maybe I have some blind spots on this one!

Put all of your house keys inside and lock the oven door tightly. This will keep your keys safe from the fire, and after an hour you can wear thin gloves, avoid triggering any smoke alarm, and pull the pan out of the oven to retrieve your keys.
idea_2 = If you think you're too small to be helpful, consider practicing on your neighbor's yard until you feel better. Especially if your neighbor seems excited about the project you're working on, their sentiments toward you will often improve dramatically if they find your work to be adequate. If you're completely certain that no one plays with you, you're likely to be much happier by instituting secret conversations with yourself when no one is around.
